intro: Fedorovia henryi var. nuda, commonly known as the naked fedorovia, is a rare and unique plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its reduced foliage and distinctive floral structures. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with small, inconspicuous leaves that are often clustered near the base. Its flowers are typically clustered in cyathia, a cup-like structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
